annotation_sentence: Um, hi. I buy... a shirt last week. But problem, it is too small.
rationale: The word 'a' is a quantifier used to indicate a single item, in this case, a shirt.

annotation_sentence: Yes, can return? I not sure about the rule.
rationale: There are no quantifiers or numerals in this sentence.

annotation_sentence: Yes, I have. Here it is.
rationale: There are no quantifiers or numerals in this sentence.

annotation_sentence: Ah, I try only. Just try in home. Still new, yes.
rationale: There are no quantifiers or numerals in this sentence.

annotation_sentence: Hmm, yes, I want bigger size. Maybe one size up.
rationale: The word 'one' is a numeral indicating a single increment in size.

annotation_sentence: Um, how to say... Large? I think large is good.
rationale: There are no quantifiers or numerals in this sentence.

annotation_sentence: Sure, no problem. I wait here.
rationale: There are no quantifiers or numerals in this sentence.

annotation_sentence: Yes, I try. Want to make sure it fit.
rationale: There are no quantifiers or numerals in this sentence.

annotation_sentence: Thank you. I will be back soon.
rationale: There are no quantifiers or numerals in this sentence.

annotation_sentence: Hello again. Large is good, it fit well.
rationale: There are no quantifiers or numerals in this sentence.

annotation_sentence: No, thank you. Just this shirt is okay.
rationale: The word 'this' is a quantifier used to specify a particular item, in this case, the shirt.

annotation_sentence: No, all is good. Thank you for your help.
rationale: The word 'all' is a quantifier indicating the entirety of something, in this case, the situation being satisfactory.

annotation_sentence: Thank you very much! Bye-b
